column1: Since COVID-19 hit nearly 30% of Vermonters have experienced food insecurity.   The CARES Act played a big role in helping feed the hungry—but the hunger relief programs expire next month. We must pass another COVID-19 relief package NOW.
Yes! Congratulations to these fantastic women and leaders.   I’m so encouraged to see a new dawn in Vermont leadership. We’re on the right path! #vtpoli   https://t.co/0F8Qbw8nop
Happy Thanksgiving from Margaret and me! To keep our loved ones safe it’ll just be the two of us this year.   I’m so grateful to each one of you as we work to build a better future together.
This holiday season please stay safe.   We can all do our part!   https://t.co/Tlw6xkLkQE

So many Vermont families are experiencing hard times right now. You are not alone. If you’re in need of some extra help this holiday season please see @VermontFoodbank's resources below!  https://t.co/mzRMakfPGu

What the president is doing is inexcusable.   Donald Trump's refusal to begin a peaceful transition of power is a threat to our national security our public health and the very basis of our democracy. https://t.co/xkTTxYFLfv

Sending encouragement to all Vermonters as we battle COVID-19 during the holiday season.  I know it’s isolating to be apart from friends & family right now. But we will get through this together—just like we did at the start of this pandemic. Stay strong!

“Vermont’s prioritization of its vulnerable populations has helped both to protect those [people] from the worst outcomes we’ve seen in other settings but also contributed to the much lower transmission rates in the state.”  Stay strong. We’ve got this.   https://t.co/KopRQkJGKP

A huge thank you to the food security advocates at @HungerFreeVT.  The CARES Act was critical to hunger relief during COVID-19 but that’s set to expire next month. We urgently need another stimulus package.  https://t.co/YGBmlizvOO

Last year I introduced legislation w/ the late Elijah Cummings that dramatically lowers prescription drug prices & saves Medicare $345 billion.  I will keep at it to get this bill over the finish line in a Biden administration & honor Elijah’s memory.  https://t.co/MhUaOk1MWA

One of my top priorities in the next Congress will be fighting for the #GreenNewDeal that Americans deserve.   It’s time to eliminate our reliance on fossil fuels & expand high-paying jobs in green industries. This can’t wait.

While uncertainty continues to brew here’s one thing I know:   House Democrats are doing everything we can to get COVID-19 relief to American individuals families & small businesses who need help right now.   https://t.co/7r8vaApKBM

The Green New Deal is an urgently needed policy—and now we know it’s a winning one too.   The American people have made their voice heard. Taking bold action on climate will be an immediate priority for me in the new Congress.   Let’s do this.   https://t.co/T0CAa0qFHF

Big thank you to @gracepotter for joining me in support of #SaveOurStages!  Too many independent venues have shut down since COVID-19 struck. This bill provides an economic lifeline to them—with most funds going right back to our community members.   https://t.co/PoMBsVX8HG

I’m pleased to see the President-elect make controlling COVID-19 an immediate priority & to lead with science in doing so.  A robust public health response—one that looks out for all Americans—will save countless lives and defeat this pandemic for good.  https://t.co/NAFAMq9ReW
Congratulations! I am excited to work with each of you on a more progressive future in January and beyond! (5/5)

✅@RitchieTorres who got his start advocating for housing rights + continues to work on the issues that matter most like health care the school system and job creation.  He also makes history as the 1st ever LGBTQ+ Afro-Latinx member of Congress! (4/5)

✅@MondaireJones a progressive champ whose 1st priority is COVID-19 relief for millions of struggling Americans. He makes history as our 1st LGBTQ+ Black Congress member!   ✅Marie4Congress who isn’t afraid to stand up to powerful interests to help working people. (3/5)

Giving a very warm welcome to some terrific new colleagues:  ✅@JamaalBowmanNY a powerful advocate for his community & the big systemic changes we need nationwide.   ✅@CoriBush a champion for justice who makes history as MO’s 1st Black Congresswoman. A true leader. (2/5)
The American people have spoken and given their mandate for a more just nation.   This is the beginning of a new era and I couldn’t be more grateful to be doing this work alongside all of you. (1/5)
This Veterans Day we honor the incredible sacrifice and courage of those who have answered the call to serve our country. Thank you and your families for standing up for us!
Margaret and I are thrilled! I hope you are connecting with your loved ones today to celebrate this historic day! https://t.co/7IkKCHvnNU

Congratulations to President-elect @JoeBiden & Vice President-elect @KamalaHarris on this historic election!  We've taken the 1st step in repairing our democracy. I look forward to working with the Biden administration to pass progressive policies that allow all of us to thrive. https://t.co/Appb6sKsWO
Ballots will continue to be counted because we are a democracy and everyone’s vote matters. Trump’s pathetic lies won’t stop that.

The President has once again shown his blatant disrespect for all voters—but this election isn’t over yet.   All votes must be counted before we declare a winner. The president will not steal this election. https://t.co/BykSZDwkyA

Congratulations to the amazing @TreasurerPearce on her reelection!   We couldn’t ask for a stronger more capable more committed leader to guide us through these uncertain times. Way to go Beth!   https://t.co/PZznlr19RA

YES! A huge congratulations to @KeshaRam who makes history as the first ever woman of color elected to our State Senate.  Kesha is an incredible thoughtful leader who will be deeply effective in furthering justice and progress in our state. I am so excited for what’s to come. https://t.co/dahahZGm3F

Awesome! Congratulations to Jim Condos on his reelection as Secretary of State.   Jim has done an exemplary job of protecting our votes this election. I am so thankful for his role in keeping the votes of all Vermonters safe as our Secretary of State. https://t.co/YEfA77x9qs
Congratulations Molly! I am so proud of you & excited for what’s to come. Vermont has gained an extremely capable smart and compassionate leader today. https://t.co/Kw9M12lpxd

A big congratulations to @TJforVermont on his reelection!   Thank you for your role in preventing voter intimidation during this election and everything else you do to serve Vermonters! https://t.co/5ZY5cDK6e7
Congratulations to @douglashoffer on his reelection as VT State Auditor.   Doug’s fierce commitment to public service and excellence make him a great fit for this job. https://t.co/MBxIeOsWGp

THANK YOU Vermonters!   I couldn’t be prouder to represent you in Washington—or more fired up to fight for our values.   A fairer more progressive future begins tonight. Thank you so much for showing up and using your voice. Let’s do this. https://t.co/i6htVr5zIN
Thanks! https://t.co/y3FSY0oYJJ

You did it! You showed up made your voice heard & now we just wait.  I know easier said than done. So come take the edge off with the @vtdems at our virtual party! Tonight we celebrate YOU.  I’ll be speaking at 8 & hope you’ll join: https://t.co/NZLpw6f9mw

What a beautiful day in Vermont and it's a day where we're going to elect a new President in the United States of America. I think we're going to do it.  If you haven’t cast your ballot yet make sure you make it to the polls before 7 p.m.! Stay close to family and friends. https://t.co/AMnWYl80am
Thank you @AOC! Lucky to call you a friend and even luckier to be in this fight for justice and progress with you. https://t.co/TKrXeF9VGu
Today is the day. Our agenda is on the ballot so VOTE! https://t.co/yjwsRc3FJj
📣And we’re LIVE! Feeling so excited for the evening ahead with these inspiring leaders.   A more progressive future is possible and it’s on the ballot. Join us here: https://t.co/QChuqzELyx
Proud to be endorsed by Senator @BernieSanders in this race who leads with progressive values always.   https://t.co/CYdqshIVjd
Join me @BernieSanders and other progressive leaders for a huge virtual rally to get out the vote tonight!   We'll be going live at 9:30 p.m. ET: https://t.co/QChuqzELyx https://t.co/Vh9P1IsRvl
I am feeling hopeful about Tuesday! Here are some final thoughts. And if you haven’t already go #VOTE and help your loved ones do the same. https://t.co/qzz8jzL3ct
Vermonters I have a question for you! How did you vote this year—or how do you plan on voting?🗳️

Young voters are such a powerful force of change and progress in Vermont & across the country. It’s so important that their voices are heard.   I know we can count on them to get their ballots in by November 3rd! #VOTE   https://t.co/7LRNptOYlO

👻 Boo! Nothing frightens me more than the thought of unreturned ballots sitting on the kitchen table.   If that sounds like you take this Halloween weekend to leave your ballot at a drop box near you:   https://t.co/kKV9VeexDF

Big thank you to Sec. Condos (@vermontsos) for shutting down Justice Kavanaugh’s misleading claims about our elections!   Additional shout-out to the folks I talked to on my Appalachian Trail hike today who were so excited to vote! #vtpoli 🍂 https://t.co/zkYK3Z5uFx

🗳️We’re so close! If you haven’t already return your ballot to your town clerk or a ballot drop box when you can!   And if you haven’t gotten your ballot yet you can still show up at your voting precinct on Nov. 3 #vtpoli #VOTE https://t.co/lgQauxzM04
I couldn’t agree more. Thanks Sec. Condos. https://t.co/LdFdKeOSrM
Love this piece and love working with the brilliant @AOC.   She is a progressive giant a leader and a friend. Excited for what’s to come!   https://t.co/44NX26Cf5K

Last night was a devastating setback.   Today I jumped right back on the campaign trail with my close friend and future Lt. Gov. @MollyforVermont to fight back even harder for Vermonters.   We discussed what’s at stake Nov. 3 and how you can help! #vtpoli https://t.co/gdJDqBNpjp
But know this: We will overcome this setback.   The 1st step? More than ever we must vote our values on Nov. 3 (or hopefully before) as if our democracy depends on it.

The GOP has shamelessly filled RBG’s SCOTUS seat on the eve of an election before the American people could vote.   This flies in the face of our democratic norms + ultimately endangers the healthcare of millions of Americans especially for our most vulnerable. (1/2)

It’s unacceptable that 865K women were pushed out of the workforce last month. Without a stronger federal response women—especially BlPOC women–are facing major setbacks.   This is a critical issue that impacts all of us. Working families need help.   https://t.co/NNQwEE2s1U

With 1 in 4 people in VT facing hunger we need critical nutrition relief programs like this to keep Vermonters safe and fed.   Peter’s encouraged to see this program continue through the pandemic when too many families are struggling.   https://t.co/o7wqvtqrnS

Peter stands with these Black community leaders 100%.  We must reckon with the racism that is sadly alive + well in our state—just like everywhere else in the U.S.—in order to enact systemic change for a more just future. https://t.co/szaWHCw5Yp

What a great day to #GoVote!  The @VermontSOS is urging all mail-in voters to get their ballots sent out TODAY in order to get your vote safely counted.   If you can spare a couple minutes drop yours off now!   https://t.co/fxGFboeDx3

Live performance venues are critical to the economic + cultural lifeblood of downtowns nationwide—but they’re in financial trouble.  If you agree that we need to do everything we can to save them add your name:  https://t.co/5PbcpszJwo

It’s been 1 year since the House passed the #SHIELDAct to keep our elections free from foreign interference.   During the most critical election of our lifetimes it’s never been more important that Mitch McConnell stop blocking this bill.

So glad to see the Vermont Book Shop which has been a mainstay in our state for 71 years safely re-open!   It’s critical that we help our small businesses get through this pandemic. https://t.co/4Buw3pd52y

Fantastic news: Vermont saw 0 unhealthy air quality days in 2020.  Peter’s so grateful for our clean air in VT & takes none of this for granted. We have to protect our climate so that EVERYONE can prosper in good health. It's time for a #GreenNewDeal.  https://t.co/qfbq7olZTf

🚨Big development for the #SaveOurStages Act which Peter introduced to help local music venues survive this pandemic!   These venues will be some of the last places to reopen and many have already been forced to shutter. We must support them!   https://t.co/86KjVXorVW

“I don’t normally vote during a global pandemic. When I do I prefer voting by mail. Vote early my friend.”   Don’t just take it from Peter. The Most Interesting Man in the World is urging you to send your ballot in early too! We can’t disappoint: #VoteEarly https://t.co/YMRIb76UXK

Yes! With so much on the line Peter’s proud of Vermonters for showing up at the ballot box.   Our democracy is at stake and we’re voting like it. Let’s get the rest of our ballots returned by THIS SATURDAY (10/24).  #vtpoli https://t.co/SOdu4PnBh9

Peter’s proud to have the support of the incredible young leaders at @sunrisemvmt Middlebury who understand that our climate can’t wait.   We need bold action on #climatejustice in order to win a better future for all of us. If you haven’t already #GoVote! 🗳️ https://t.co/v1aq7UxDAI

Peter’s so grateful to have the support of thoughtful + visionary leaders like @KeshaRam a terrific candidate for State Senate from Chittenden County. She's a huge part of VT's future! https://t.co/px6bebTbAw

📣Time to rally! Peter’s speaking at the Virtual Get Out the Vote Rally tomorrow + you’re invited.   We’re in the final stretch of this election + we’ve come so far! Come hear an exciting slate of @vtdems candidates + meet other supporters all over VT!  https://t.co/ByLvUN0pcP

Any Dave Matthews fans around here? 🤚  This weekend Peter will be watching him + other inspiring artists play at the virtual #SOSFest in support of #SaveOurStages.  It’s critical that our local music venues get the support they need during COVID-19.  https://t.co/6QInyH8GEK

VT’s Covid response has been outstanding. Vermonters have stepped up and been vigilant and thoughtful throughout the pandemic.  We’ve all taken precautions for our community our neighbors our loved ones. Don't stop now. Keep up the good work VT!   https://t.co/FrwmJ4iw9H
Yes! I strongly support global health programs like Gavi Global Fund and CEPI. https://t.co/adNRfwoIxC

Defending local cheesemakers like Mateo (of @jasperhillfarm) from misguided FDA regulation is one of Peter’s favorite memories on Capitol Hill.   To get the full story later today sign up for Peter’s email list here! https://t.co/IdY6sPvDE6 https://t.co/DYIKliLDQR

Republicans have flouted norms precedent and even committee rules to cram in a midnight-hour SCOTUS nominee before an election.   This process has been offensive and a gross violation of our democratic norms.   A vote must be delayed until the voters have spoken. https://t.co/e86bwJyZFF

🏆Vermonters: You’ve outdone yourselves and made state history—and we’re still 3 weeks out from the election!   But we can’t lose steam now. Make sure you return your ballot safely + as soon as possible!   We’ve got this. #VTPoli https://t.co/6Vqhi47tdp

“Justice Ginsburg left us with our marching orders: no Supreme Court confirmation until the next president is inaugurated.”  Thank you for these words Senator—and for making the stakes of this SCOTUS appointment crystal clear.   I completely agree: A vote must wait. https://t.co/wmatr15CEU

Vermonters: Peter’s already cast his ballot—have you? #vtpoli  The earlier you can submit your ballot the better. You can return it to:   📬Your mailbox 🗳️A ballot drop-box 🏛️Your town clerk’s office  ☑️A polling location on Election Day https://t.co/WL2C8GCp4k

Happy Indigenous People’s Day Vermonters!  Last year Vermont became just the 3rd state to abolish “Columbus Day”.   This year we’re very excited for our 2nd official celebration of the history achievements and culture of Vermont’s Abenaki people.

Big thanks to Jack Hedges and all of our front line providers in VT who have administered nearly 170k COVID-19 tests. Jack gave Peter a COVID-19 test at the end of last week which came back negative after he (safely) traveled to DC.   Vermonters stay safe and wear a mask! https://t.co/icqpbPfSul

Wow! 78000 ballots returned and counting.   Now let’s get the rest of those ballots in early before Nov. 3. With so much at stake we can’t leave anything to chance or the last minute. #GoVote! #vtpoli https://t.co/YXthrUhO33

🚨VERMONTERS: If you haven’t received your ballot in the mail yet contact your town clerk!  Once you’ve got yours in-hand don’t wait to send it in. With a president desperate to mess with our votes we can’t leave anything to chance. #VTPoli  https://t.co/onarkRjfDR
Couldn’t agree more!   Peter’s so proud to support @mollyforvermont for Lt. Gov. When it comes to defending Vermont values Molly gets the job done. Let’s go Molly! 💪 #vtpoli https://t.co/SraF4QPeTI

“For 14 years I’ve brought the Vermont way to Washington. Hard work civility respect and progressive values. If reelected I’ll continue to fight for all Vermonters.” #VTPoli  Check out Peter's Candidate Commentaries video! (He's #4 in the playlist.)  https://t.co/m6tEzQLGgY

LGBTQ+ rights.  Voting rights.  Abortion rights.  The Affordable Care Act which provides healthcare to 20M people.  All of these protections + more could be on SCOTUS’ chopping block. Voters need to be heard before a confirmation.

Marriage equality is not a ‘novelty.’ It’s a human right.   We cannot return to our ugly history of legal discrimination against LGBTQ+ Americans. Voters must have a voice in the next SCOTUS pick.   https://t.co/OmNRvD6ZV1

Americans need relief NOW in the wake of Trump’s reckless + botched covid response.   But Trump is holding economic aid hostage until after the election. This means individuals families small businesses and schools will suffer.  It is unconscionable.  https://t.co/o64flLux7O

“Vermont businesses needed help in May and they need it even more today.”  Last week Peter voted in favor of the updated #HEROESAct. The Senate has failed to act on robust COVID-19 relief for months but Vermonters + small businesses need relief now.   https://t.co/qaHUrPofEl

We’ll miss you Thomas Dairy. Local agriculture is such a critical part of our economy.   This is a heartbreaking loss for Rutland & Vermont. We need far greater support for farmers (& the local eateries they help supply) in our pandemic response.   https://t.co/en19cuHVco

Did you catch Peter’s panel with Rep. Bass on racial bias + police reform this week?   They were joined by VT racial justice leaders Xusana Davis Kesha Ram Steffen Gillom and Noel Riby-Williams. Check it out below:  https://t.co/UdjLcnaCuQ

✅The Save Our Stages Act is one step closer to being passed!   90% of National Independent Venues Association members said they’d be forced to close permanently without federal assistance. This provision will provide much-needed relief.   https://t.co/wED4AAPfJs

This week Peter’s been in hearings w/ pharma CEOs about the soaring price of rx drugs and to expose the broken pharmaceutical market. We must lower costs for Americans & uphold the legacy of the late Rep. Cummings.   https://t.co/XenegDMlrA

“In my 30 years of doing this work I've never seen something this egregious.”   The Families Food Box Program is critical to hunger relief here in Vermont + other states.  Now Trump is trying to use it for self-promotion before the election.   https://t.co/B3rp6UI2hc

Peter fought for VT’s shared values in yesterday’s VT U.S. House Debate:   ✅Affordable health care  ✅Efficient energy programs ✅A path for citizenship for undocumented workers. No wall.  ✅ Defending Roe v. Wade  #VTPoli  https://t.co/dhFGfP0jex

This week's debate made one thing clear: We have to fight harder than ever for our democracy.   Peter’s always willing to go to bat for Vermonters. Will you chip in today to send him into Nov. 3 with the strongest backing possible?   https://t.co/73GH8YBdXN

“Uninhibited pricing power has transformed America's pain into pharma's profit." — Peter at today’s Oversight hearing.   As pharmaceutical profits soar it’s taxpayers and sick Americans who are footing the bill.   https://t.co/YlDMVsqpcQ
Trump is a liar and a serious threat to our democracy.   The good news - we can vote! And tell our friends family and neighbors to vote! https://t.co/vlccFfNzRL

Trump evades paying federal income taxes for 10 of the last 15 years.  What does this tell us?  Trump is a scam artist and cheat and he looks out for himself every day. He does this at the expense of hard working Americans trying to make ends meet. https://t.co/AZKMflKibT

📩Vermonters have you checked the mail recently?   The first batch of mail-in ballots were sent out this week! With so much at stake this election the earlier you get your ballot in the better.   https://t.co/DP1sanbE7f

“Thousands of protests. 45 arrests. 33 years in Congress.”  Don’t miss it: @VermontFilm is hosting a special outdoor screening of “John Lewis: Good Trouble” tonight at 7:15 p.m. Join us in observing the incredible life & advocacy of the late Rep. Lewis. https://t.co/8Mci3t8sUr

The Senate must delay a vote on the next Supreme Court Justice until the American people have spoken on who will be their president for the next four years.   If you agree add your name here: https://t.co/2UDFipyvLD

✅Peter’s proud to earn another 100% rating from the @ActForParks scorecard!   With our climate’s future at risk it’s critical that we #ActForParks by providing robust funding & support for this public good we can all enjoy.   https://t.co/9sjk27eBdw

Independent music venues are hurting b/c of Covid.   According to @nivassoc 90% of its members may have to close their doors w/o government assistance. We need the #SaveOurStages Act now!  Venues have already closed. Let's not allow anymore to close. https://t.co/iMasSBI3p4

Happy #NationalVoterRegistrationDay! With the most important election of our lifetime coming up in 6 weeks make sure you’re registered (and help your loved ones sign up too).  Link to register: https://t.co/ONuPSLVtgx https://t.co/h69FP0s3w4
Peter’s full statement on the devastating passing of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg below:  https://t.co/Awbfm8p85o

85M pieces of mail were delayed between Aug. 8 - Aug. 14 alone. With a record # of mail-in ballots ahead this puts our election in peril.   It’s crucial that we get the #DeliveringForAmerica Act passed to ensure our ballots are delivered on time.   https://t.co/T7JJNEbI4Q

You’re invited to a special outdoor screening of “John Lewis: Good Trouble” on 9/26.   The film spans 6 decades of tireless social activism from the late Rep. Lewis. Peter is honored to be making introductions & speaking in his memory.   Save the date!  https://t.co/6xjRdkDlFb

“What’s the cost of us doing nothing?” —On why we need to fund programs that can help small businesses get through this crisis.  Peter was excited to speak w/ @davidgoodmanvt on his podcast Vermont Conversation (@vtdigger) this week. Check it out!   https://t.co/bMzV2mBpvV
Thank you! Peter's proud to be running alongside this impressive slate of Democrats. Vermonters make sure you've got a plan to vote in November. https://t.co/t6T90MFCeF

“Please you’ve done so well don’t let your guard down.”   This week Dr. Anthony Fauci said he wishes he “could bottle” Vermont’s COVID-19 response and implement it all over the US.   Keep it up Vermonters!   https://t.co/q29QgnokcK

🗣Peter’s taking to the stage (via Zoom) tomorrow night to discuss the important issues of this election with other candidates #VTpoli.   Make sure you tune in at 5:30pm to support Team Welch! https://t.co/wcl4ARFeEc

Blue Sparrow in Norwich. Chan’s House in Bradford. Thai Basil in Manchester.   You all sent in a slew of local gems in solidarity with VT restaurants struggling during this pandemic. Peter’s ready to protect them and their employees with the #RESTAURANTSAct.

Today we disavow that false idea and confront the facts of history head-on.   Slavery was not restricted to the South in the 1800s—nor is systemic racism restricted to any state today.   Today we renew our solidarity with those impacted and our commitment to a better future.

Peter was honored to speak about the Stopping Stones’ markers in commemoration of Lavinia & Francis Parker.   The mother & son were enslaved by the daughter of Ethan Allen decades after Vermont joined the union as a free state. https://t.co/X0NrOlLpvw

🚩Restaurants have been one of the slowest industry’s to recover from the pandemic.  The hardworking people who make up these local institutions need a lifeline right now. Let’s help them out! It’s time to pass the #RestaurantsAct!   https://t.co/adUx0GLnxT

✅Still time to apply for @emergevt’s training program. Learn the ins-and-outs of campaigning AND join a powerful network of female leaders.   There’s a place for everyone to impact #VTpoli whatever your age background or socioeconomic status.   https://t.co/o9ZagOYz4i

Vermonters we breathe some of the cleanest air in the US thanks in large part to the #CleanAirAct.   Peter’s sharing his #MyCleanAirStory in honor of the 50th anniversary of this landmark policy—and draw awareness to how much we still need it.  Thanks to @LungAssociation! https://t.co/95zaZuQM9D

Get out your calendars Vermonters: Peter’s hosting a Community Call with the @vtdems tonight from 7-8 p.m.   You’re invited for an evening of fun candid conversation with VT’s at-large Rep. and all the #vtpoli you could hope for. RSVP here!   https://t.co/qbe64NxAPn

Nothing beats takeout from Carpenter & Main and its top chef Bruce! What are some of your favorite local bites in #Vermont? Tag them in the replies! 👇  Peter's proud to cosponsor the RESTAURANTS Act which provides a lifeline to our small businesses during this crisis. https://t.co/TcwZ8XMBlF

Confirmed once again - the President and his cronies will do all they can to "not look bad" at the expense of the American people and our democracy. We must defeat him in 55 days.   https://t.co/INGJioz5dA

Happy first day of #PrideVermont! This week we’re full-heartedly celebrating the hard fought wins and recommitting to all that’s left to do in the fight for LGBTQ+ equality.   Check out this great week of programming organized by @PrideCenterVT!   https://t.co/UQJRqV00ji

“Without Black women the U.S. labor movement undoubtedly would have been doomed from the start.”   We owe so much of the modern labor movement to Black women & activists. On this #LaborDay we celebrate these brave leaders. We are in gratitude.   https://t.co/AgfjfhY7K1

Labor union workers built modern America served on the front line of this pandemic and will rebuild our communities in the aftermath of COVID-19.  This #LaborDay let’s recognize the good work being done by VT’s unions and all our essential workers. Thank you!

The @vtdems Women's Weekend of Action continues- phone-banking with:  @TreasurerPearce (the only VT woman in statewide elected office) & @mollyforvermont (candidate for Lt. Gov)!    We’ll be reaching out to voters all over VT. Please join if you can! https://t.co/UG6YU67Jr2

Team Welch is excited to hear @TreasurerPearce and @mollyforvermont speak tonight as part of the @vtdems Women’s Weekend of Action!   We’ve got a lot to learn from these two trailblazers and we hope you’ll join us!  ✅RSVP below:  https://t.co/L4YQivJt6Z

# of climate questions asked in 2016 debates: 0   That can’t happen in 2020. This summer alone we’ve seen record wildfires a forceful Atlantic hurricane season and an oppressively hot August.   We’ve had enough. Make climate a debate centerpiece.   https://t.co/SHKNnehLN4

Climate change isn’t a far-off possibility. It’s here and it’s hitting the margins of our society the hardest.   Low-income nonwhite VTers bear the brunt of these changes. The environmental & health disparities are not ok.  We must take bold action now. https://t.co/1f71AHrmPu

📣VT Farmers: There are still grants available for COVID-19 relief but the 10/1 deadline is approaching!  Many of our farmers have been hit hard by this crisis & need some help getting back on their feet. If that's you we encourage you to apply below!  https://t.co/334Oxo0lz6

“Without these spaces for cultural and community gathering the country’s music scene will be bleak.” —@gracepotter  Peter’s working to pass the #SavingOurStages Act to keep these live music venues afloat during this crisis. https://t.co/ecb11P60F6

What’s your favorite book read during the pandemic? Peter’s is Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass.   Team Welch is a big fan of libraries and we’re proud of Vermont’s local branches for being so resilient during this pandemic! TY @vermontlib!   https://t.co/Iz4aYQdCgr
